revised_title: Investigation of Dissociation Pressures and Melting Points of Copper-Cuprous Oxide System
tldr: This article investigates the dissociation pressures and melting points of the copper-cuprous oxide system. The authors found that the melting point of pure cuprous oxide is around 1210°C, and mixtures with compositions between 20% and 95% cuprous oxide separate into two layers at temperatures above 1195°C. The study also determined the dissociation pressures of the system and provided insights into the phase behavior of the copper-cuprous oxide system.
